intro: Galium praemontanum, commonly known as the mountain bedstraw, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant features slender, ascending stems that are often hairy and bear opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its small, white flowers are clustered in umbels and bloom in late spring to early summer. Galium praemontanum is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
